title: Conostomum tetragonum
text:
Conostomum tetragonum, or helmet-moss, is a species of <a href="bryophyte">bryophyte</a> found in <a href="Europe">Europe</a>.
Shoots grow to a maximum height of 2 cm. Leaves are shaped like narrow spearheads and sharply pointed. Capsules are nearly spherical and 2mm long.
It thrives in acidic, rocky <a href="mountain">mountain</a> soils, especially where there is <a href="snow%20line">snow cover</a> for a large part of the year, and on summit ridges. It grows in continental Europe and in <a href="Scotland">Scotland</a>. This species became extinct in England in the 1950s.
